doc.after: A panoramic view of Blois, the capital of Loir-et-Cher department in central France, situated on the banks of the lower river Loire between OrlÃ©ans and Tours. The area has been inhabited since at least the 6th century and was once the seat of a powerful countship. It is also known for being Joan of Arc's base of operations for the relief of OrlÃ©ans.
